thread.title: The Blue Book Building and Construction Network Set to Launch Second Round of Networking and Educational Events
thread.title_full: The Blue Book Building and Construction Network Set to Launch Second Round of Networking and Educational Events

author: Michael Tartaglia
title: The Blue Book Building and Construction Network Set to Launch Second Round of Networking and Educational Events
text:
The Blue Book Building and Construction Network has announced its remaining schedule of local Showcases for 2015. For over a decade, these free local events have provided building and construction professionals with a powerful combination of business networking and industry education. Fall Blue Book Network Showcase Schedule:
10/8 Portland, OR – Oregon Convention Center
10/22 Baltimore, MD – M&T Bank Stadium
10/28 Central Valley, CA - Visalia Convention Center
11/3 Milwaukee, WI – Harley-Davidson Museum
11/17 Anaheim, CA – Angel Stadium
"The Blue Book Network Showcase is an incredible opportunity for anyone who hires or buys from contractors, suppliers and manufacturers to expand their vendor list with qualified companies and stay competitive in this marketplace," explained Rich Johnson, President of The Blue Book Network. "In addition, these events provide an unmatched opportunity for local subcontractors and suppliers to get qualified for upcoming projects, solidify relationships with existing customers and build new ones,” he added.
Each local event will offer a pre-Showcase lunch seminar with topics covering best practices and new technologies to help build brand and increase project opportunities.
To register as an exhibitor or attendee, visit: http://www.thebluebook.com/showcase or call 800-431-2584. For media inquiries or exclusive sponsorship opportunities contact Michael Tartaglia, Director of Network Events at mtartaglia(at)thebluebook(dot)com.
About The Blue Book Building and Construction Network:
The Blue Book Network, an Employee-Owned enterprise, is the largest and most active construction network in the United States. For over one hundred years, the commercial construction industry has turned to The Blue Book Network for accurate, complete and up-to-date information on the people and products required for their projects. The company maintains a nationwide industry search engine at http://www.thebluebook.com powered by BlueSearch technology. In addition, The Blue Book Network provides a complete suite of Internet-based information, workflow and marketing resources for all segments of the building and construction industry.
